definition: to make friends/(dialect) to start an affair with sb
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]

sentences.english: Some people regard friendship as a game.
sentences.chinese: 有的人把交朋友當作是逢場作戲。

sentences.english: Nobody liked to make friends with a small-minded man.
sentences.chinese: 沒有人喜歡與一個心胸狹窄的人交朋友。

sentences.english: In Paris, cocktail parties offer good opportunities for making friends.
sentences.chinese: 在巴黎，雞尾酒會是廣交朋友的好機會。

sentences.english: During the first few months of college, everyone wants to make friends.
sentences.chinese: 在大學的頭幾個月裏，每個人都想要互相交朋友。

sentences.english: You should make friends with your equals or betters .
sentences.chinese: 你應該與和自己同等或比你更好的人交朋友。

sentences.english: I think that person can not blindly self-surrender, for example, to make friends.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲做人不可以一味的忍讓，比如說交朋友。
和有正能量的人交朋友。

sentences.english: Joe Walsh didn't go to Washington to make friends.
sentences.chinese: 喬沃爾什沒有去華盛頓，廣交朋友。

sentences.english: He associates with all kinds of people.
The Greek sailer feels proud to be friends with a Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 這個希臘水手覺得同中國人交朋友值得自豪。

sentences.english: Who set the rules of money Dingren, heart friends potential dog.
sentences.chinese: 人定規矩錢定人，心交朋友勢交狗。

sentences.english: They love shaving lots of friends, so do those with disabilities.
sentences.chinese: 他們喜歡廣交朋友，殘疾人也一樣。

sentences.english: Do you find it easy to make friends here at your school?
sentences.chinese: 你覺得在你們學校交朋友容易嗎？

sentences.english: Get acquainted with successful people and ask what drives them.
sentences.chinese: 與成功的人交朋友，並向他們請益成功之道。

sentences.english: Bona fides is my first choice of making friends.
sentences.chinese: 真誠是我交朋友的首選。

sentences.english: Never contract friendship with a man that is not better than thyself.
sentences.chinese: 永遠不要和那些各個方面都不如自己的人交朋友。

definition: to be able to talk to/to get along with/to be congenial
to associate (with)/to have contact (with)/to hang out (with)/to date/(interpersonal) relationship/association/contact
to be in contact (with sb)/to associate/to interact/to get along (well, poorly)
to get along well/compatible/also written 和得來|和得来[he2 de5 lai2]
to court/to go steady/to be dating
good friend/(slang) a visit from Aunt Flo (menstrual period)
